# Open Badges

After confirming with Jim - Open Badges it is!

High level Overview of domain space. Dated though: April 15th, 2015

Ted Talk Overview Digital Badges (opens new window)

What Are Open Badges? (opens new window)

"The OBI allows any organization to build upon a secure yet open foundation. Potential badge issuers can be assured that the credentials they issue will be displayable anywhere on the web. Badge earners gain the advantage of being able to collect and curate their knowledge, skills, and experience from across the web in one place. And badge ‚Äòconsumers‚Äôcan trust that the badges shown to them can be verified and trusted."

Open Badges v2.0 IMS Final Release (opens new window)

Fields derived from above OB common certification JSON file:

Organization is the top of the object tree. Organizations can issue certificates and Organizations can contain recipients of certificates, however, recipients do not need to be part of an organization or group.

Table Name: Organizations

Groups could be departments, teams, or other types of groups that might exist inside the organization.

  • Organization Name

Table Name: Groups

Table Name: Recipients

Field Name Description
id ID for unique identification of the recipient of the certificate
name Name of the Recipient
email Email of the Recipient
completedcourses Relational Key for list of courses attended
badgerequests Who has requested and been sent a copy of the badge
badgerequestmeta Relational key to additional information provided by the badge requestor
issuermeta Relational key to additional information from issuer

Table Name: Certificates

Field Name Description
id ID for unique identification of the certificate
type List of supported environmental variables
name Example configuration file
description More to come!
image More to come!
criteria More to come!

Table Name: Issuers

Field Name Description
id ID for unique identification of the Issuer
orgid Relational key to ID for unique identification of the organization
TBD More to come!
TBD More to come!

Table Name: Badges

Field Name Description
